name: HackerNest Greater LA Tech Social
description:
***RSVP here or at HackerNest Los Angeles ***

Drinks on us. That's right: free beer/(possibly wine)/water.

HackerNest Tech Socials are a fun, relaxed way to connect with your local tech community. Atmosphere: chill, friendly, unpretentious, agenda-free (no sales pitch, yo), and brimming with UltraSmart(TM) people. 

Join us for a great night of drinks, games and tech discussions with our friends at Uncoded and WE Labs!

The typical Tech Social schedule: 
- 7:30pm: folks arrive, grab drinks, socialize 
- 8:30pm: quick intro, thank sponsors, quick announcements 
- 8:40pm: back to chatting with interesting people and new friends 
- 10:30pm: go home exhausted from great conversations 

Venue: WE Labs @ The Packard 

WE Labs (www.welabs.us)WE Labs is a Long Beach coworking space built on community and creativity. WE are a community where work, life and adventure overlap. Together WE create opportunities for idea sharing, business referrals, lunch partners, engaging events, and friendships with like minded people.

Community Partners

Uncoded

Uncoded (www.uncoded.org) is a volunteer organization with the aim to inspire, bring together, and ignite local tech community. We do that by identifying synergies that exist in the local tech scene, holding events and facilitating ongoing tech initiatives.

Drupal Camp

DrupalCamp LA is the annual FREE unconference-style conference for the Drupal community in Los Angeles, Orange County, and the Greater Southern California Area.


Check out http://2016.drupalcampla.com/ for more information

Sponsors make this growing movement possible, so we treasure and build deep, long-term relationships with the companies that endorse us. We're always looking for new friends!

----->

Hack4Equality

HackerNest has partnered with Grindr and the White House Opportunity Project to produce Hack4Equality, a 7-week hackathon bringing together brilliant minds to craft technology-based solutions to critical issues affecting the global LGBTQ community. 

Ticket registration is now open! Sign up here: 

www.hack4equality2016.eventbrite.com

**** 
We're looking for 2-3 local organizers to help start/run the HackerNest splinter cell! 

We've got some great events coming up and we'd love the LA tech community to get involved!

Check out http://hackernest.com/faqs/for-future-organizers/ or email [masked] and apply if you're interested! 

****

About Us:

</a><a href="http://hackernest.com/">HackerNest is an international nonprofit uniting local tech communities through unpretentious Tech Socials and hackathons. We cram lots of smart, accomplished people into a room with free drinks. Our relaxed, down-to-earth events attract a diverse and highly technical membership. Strict no-douchebag policy.
